duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage development and manufacturing of sterile and non-sterile pharmaceutical products for small molecules and biological therapy entities.
Oversee activities at manufacturing facilities from pre-IND to late-stage manufacturing and product validation.
Plan and execute development/manufacturing strategies to support human clinical supply.
Provide leadership for process development/scale-up/validation/transfer activities at internal and external sites.
Coordinate new drug product in-process and release testing, and develop appropriate process flow and control strategy for manufacturing.
Present results and progress of development and manufacturing programs to internal and external clients.
Prepare and review documents related to development and GMP operations to support regulatory filings.
Work collaboratively with Quality Assurance to ensure cGMP compliant.

education_certification.credential: BS/MS/PhD in Pharmaceutical Sciences, Chemistry, Microbiology, Chemical/Biomedical Engineering, Materials Science or other related discipline required.
5-year plus working knowledge of FDA/ICH/EMA guidelines and cGMPs, familiar with requirements for IND, NDA, and BLA submissions and experience with IND/BLA/MAA documentation.
Understanding principles of Quality by Design (QbD) and Design of Experiment (DoE) for optimization of drug product formulation and/or manufacturing process.
